1.title: Boxed In: Terminal Trouble
1.plot: Robert visits Philadelphia's "Packer Avenue Marine Terminal", where he'll prepare a hearty lunch for 150 longshoremen, using imported goods from around the world.

2.title: Dorm Food Doom
2.plot: Robert Irvine heads to the University of North Carolina to prepare a gourmet meal for 100 students, but he can only use ingredients that are found in their dorm rooms.

3.title: Ironman Obstacles
3.plot: Robert arrives at the Ironman Arizona to compete in his own culinary triathlon, featuring three challenges in one mission.

4.title: Destroyer Disaster
4.plot: The host must complete two missions in one day when he boards the USS Wayne E. Meyer, a U.S. Navy destroyer.

5.title: Pirate Peril
5.plot: Chef Irvine cooks up authentic pirate fare at the annual Pirates in Paradise Festival in Key West, Florida. On the menu: bone soup; hardtack; sea turtle; and pickled preserves.

6.title: Balloon Blowup
6.plot: Chef Robert has seven hours to cook a reception for 200 pilots and sponsors at the 29th Annual Red Rock Balloon Rally in Gallup, New Mexico. Unfortunately, he has to go shopping while the five mandates of his mission still float above him.

7.title: Robert's Lost Mission
7.plot: Robert has just seven hours to feed 90 cast and crew from the series LOST, and just like the characters in the show he'll have to 'make do' - before he can even begin to cook, he must build his kitchen.

8.title: Disney Dilemma
8.plot: Robert heads to Walt Disney World to prepare a gourmet meal, for 400 people, in celebration of Family Volunteer Day.

9.title: Speed Dating Downfall
9.plot: Robert prepares dinner for 100 speed daters, and he's set up with some special ingredients that must make their way into the meal.

10.title: Judgment Day
10.plot: Chef Irvine helps celebrate the 2000th episode of Divorce Court (1999), by separating some tired food marriages, like fish and chips, and rematching them into exciting new pairs. Judge Lynn Toler helps rate the dishes.

11.title: Caffeine Crash
11.plot: Robert must use coffee and tea in every dish he makes for a party at the "Peet's Coffee and Tea" roasting facility in Alameda, California.

12.title: Mission in the Mud
12.plot: The weather doesn't cooperate when Robert has to cook an elaborate gourmet meal outdoors, using camping equipment.

13.title: Spring Training Tangle
13.plot: Robert heads to Clearwater, Florida, home of the Philadelphia Phillies spring training camp, and prepares a meal for 200 baseball players, using major and minor league ingredients.

1.title: Here Comes the Chef: Wedding - Impossible
1.plot: A wedding challenge gives chef Robert Irvine 10 hours to plan an entire menu and prepare a gourmet meal for 200 guests.

2.title: Beg, Borrow and Steal: Tailgating - Impossible
2.plot: Preparing a game-day gourmet lunch for 40 Philadelphia Eagles executives, using only food and equipment acquired from tailgates.

3.title: Miles Off the Coast: Fundraiser - Impossible
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

4.title: Back in Time: Ye Ol' Dinner Impossible
4.plot: An 18th-century meal is prepared for food historians in Williamsburg, Virginia, using only colonial ingredients and tools.

5.title: Race on the Rails: Dinner Train - Impossible
5.plot: Creating a five-course meal for 160 passengers in a tiny kitchen aboard the Sierra Railroad Dinner Train in California.

6.title: British Cowboy: Cattle Drive: Impossible
6.plot: Fourteen authentic cowboy dishes are made on an open fire for 500 hungry people on a cattle drive in central Florida.

7.title: Stranded: Deserted Island - Impossible
7.plot: Preparing a tropical feast, on a deserted island, in under four hours.

8.title: Infiltrating the CIA: Internationally: Impossible
8.plot: Chef Robert Irvine is given only one tool to face-off against internationally renowned master chefs.

9.title: Secret Service: Inauguration Impossible
9.plot:

10.title: A Hollywood Ambush: Premier Impossible
10.plot:
Know what this is about?

11.title: The Frozen Chef: Ice Hotel: Impossible
11.plot: A hot meal must be prepared, without melting the surroundings, in a hotel made out of ice.

12.title: Rush Dinner: Frat House: Impossible
12.plot: A filthy frat house serves as the venue for a cocktail reception and a five-course meal for 66 distinguished guests.

13.title: Boot Camp: Military Base - Impossible
13.plot: Preparing a satisfying meal for 850 hungry Marines, before they're deployed overseas.

1.title: Major League Ballpark Challenge
1.plot: Robert heads to a White Sox-Yankees game in Chicago, where he must feed 200 fans by the seventh-inning stretch.

2.title: Spelling Bee: Impossible
2.plot: A four-course meal is made for 1100 attendees of the Scripps National Spelling Bee and it must include ingredients that represent each letter of the alphabet.

3.title: Lunch Lady Land
3.plot: Three Philadelphia School District lunch ladies and one sous chef help cater a graduation celebration for 600 people in six hours.

4.title: Night Shift Impossible
4.plot: Robert, a fairly inexperienced baker, works the night shift at a New Jersey bakery. He must make 2400 pastries before the store's early-morning opening.

5.title: Dinner Under Construction
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: The Catwalk Chef
6.plot: Robert has eight hours to create upscale hors d'oeuvres for a New York City fashion show. Two models serve as sous chefs.

7.title: Celebrity Golf Tournament
7.plot: Robert has six hours to feed 250 people at the American Century Championship Celebrity Golf Tournament in Lake Tahoe, Nevada.

8.title: Camp Cookoff: Robert vs. Guy
8.plot: Robert Irvine faces guest chef Guy Fieri in the first annual Camp Cook-off at Camp Chen-a-Wanda in northeastern Pennsylvania.

9.title: Mall Madness
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Magicians Meal
10.plot: Actor Neil Patrick Harris serves as sous-chef as Robert has to feed magicians and guests at the "Magic Live!" convention in Las Vegas.

11.title: Pixar Movie Mission
11.plot: Within 6 hours, Robert must create and cook a Pixar-influenced lunch menu, for 600 Pixar employees, inspired by the films, "Ratatouille", "Cars" and "Finding Nemo", at the Pixar Animation Studios in San Francisco.

12.title: Elvis Eats
12.plot: Priscilla Presley greets Robert at the Graceland mansion in Memphis and instructs him to create a family-style dinner for 100 die-hard Elvis fans.

13.title: Mission: Holiday Hope
13.plot:
Know what this is about?

1.title: Cruise Against the Clock
1.plot: Robert heads to Ketchikan, Alaska, where he has less than eight hours to prepare hors d'oeuvres for 2000 cruise-ship passengers.

2.title: Air Force Anniversary
2.plot: Robert caters a party celebrating the U.S. Air Force's 60th anniversary in Wichita Falls, Texas. His gourmet menu must feed 1,000 officers and VIPs.

3.title: Medieval Mayhem
3.plot: Preparing a lavish feast, fit for a king, at the Maryland Renaissance Festival.

4.title: Circus Juggling
4.plot: Performers in the "Big Apple Circus" represent many nationalities, and Robert must satisfy their diverse palates with a buffet dinner.

5.title: Robert & the Chocolate Factory
5.plot: A five-course gourmet dinner is prepared and chocolate must be incorporated into each dish, when Robert heads to Hershey, Pennsylvania.

6.title: Late for the Hawaiian Luau
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: Santa Fe Struggle
7.plot: Robert prepares a quintessential New Mexican meal in an outdoor 18th-century kitchen for Santa Fe's 400th anniversary.

8.title: Culture Clash Wedding
8.plot: Catering a cross-cultural wedding reception in Kirkland, Washington, with a gourmet menu that fuses Asian and Irish cuisine.

9.title: Groundhog Daze
9.plot: Surprise guest chefs from Robert Irvine's past show up during a Groundhog Day challenge in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, where he must work through the night.

10.title: Firehouse Fiasco
10.plot: Robert has seven hours to prepare a dinner for 75 firefighters in a tiny firehouse kitchen.

11.title: Operation: Improv
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Brewhouse Bites
12.plot: Craft beers are used in a five-course gourmet meal for 100 brewers and tasters at the Anheuser-Busch brewery in St. Louis.

1.title: Disney Dinner Dash
1.plot: Robert goes on a scavenger hunt through the four theme parks at Walt Disney World in Florida.

2.title: Puerto Rican Predicament
2.plot: Robert has nine hours to prepare a traditional Puerto Rican feast plus an elaborate birthday cake for a girl's quinceanera.

3.title: Far East Feast
3.plot: Robert caters a Japanese gala that will kick off the National Cherry Blossom Festival in Washington, D.C.

1.title: X Food at the X Games
1.plot: Chef Robert Irvine is at the Winter X Games in Aspen, Colorado, where he'll have seven hours to prepare a meal for 200 athletes, while working in extreme outdoor conditions.

2.title: Yahoo Search Scramble
2.plot: Robert must make 15 of the Internet's most searched-for dishes when he caters a party at the Yahoo. headquarters in Sunnyvale, California.

3.title: Casino Craziness
3.plot: Robert visits the "Mohegan Sun" in Uncasville, Conn., where he'll spin a roulette wheel to see how many people he'll be serving, play blackjack to win ingredients, and roll dice at the craps table to see how many hours he'll have to cook.

4.title: NBA All-Star Stress
4.plot: Robert creates a menu, inspired by five NBA teams in the Western and Eastern conferences, at a NBA "Cares & Cooks" fund-raising event.

5.title: Crossword Puzzle Crisis
5.plot: Robert must incorporate various food-related sayings into his dishes when he caters the awards luncheon at the 2009 American Crossword Puzzle Tournament in Brooklyn.

6.title: Barbie's Birthday Celebration
6.plot: Robert rushes to put together a dinner party in celebration of the iconic Barbie doll's 50th birthday.

1.title: Roller Derby Debacle
1.plot: Chef Irvine has eight hours to prepare a meal, that requires no utensils, for 250 Roller Derby girls in Wildwood, N.J.

2.title: Candy Catastrophe
2.plot: Robert must incorporate candy into every dish when he caters a party for 250 people at "Dylan's Candy Bar" in New York City.

3.title: Amusement Park Adventure
3.plot: Robert arrives at Six Flags Great America and learns he'll have nine hours to transform standard amusement-park fare into a gourmet meal.

4.title: Feeding Frenzy at the Zoo
4.plot: Robert caters a dinner for 500 at the Philadelphia Zoo, where every dish must be based on the diets of the zoo's four most popular animals: big cats, primates, birds and reptiles.

5.title: Food Court Fiasco
5.plot: Robert works through the night in order to simultaneously open seven restaurants in a food court at the historic Bourse building in Philadelphia.

6.title: Ice Cream Meltdown
6.plot: At the Ben & Jerry factory in Vermont, Robert has nine hours to prepare a meal for 400 employees, and each dish must be based on one of Ben & Jerry's 15 flavors of ice cream.

7.title: Block Party
7.plot: Robert arrives at a block party and learns he'll be competing in a cook-off against his sous chef, David Britton, one of his closest allies.

8.title: Sesame Street Scramble
8.plot: Chef Irvine helps Sesame Place in Langhorne, Pennsylvania, celebrate Sesame Street's 40th birthday.

9.title: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame: Rock the Chef
9.plot: Chef Irvine must make a six-genre themed dinner for VIPs at the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland.

10.title: Double Jeopardy
10.plot: Robert prepares dinner for 250 twins at the annual Twins Days Festival (the largest annual gathering of twins) in Twinsburg, Ohio.

11.title: WWE: A Mission on the Mat
11.plot: Chef Irvine makes dinner for 300 VIPs who've attended WWE's SummerSlam event, and he must use their superstars' signature moves as inspiration when he creates his menu.

12.title: Newseum: Museum Mayhem
12.plot: Robert visits the Newseum in Washington, D.C., where he'll prepare a newsworthy meal based on major food events in American history, including early Thanksgiving feasts; WWI food shortages; the invention of TV dinners.

13.title: Robert and Guy's Holiday Havoc
13.plot: Guy Fieri surprises Robert Irvine and presents him with his challenge: create an over-the-top holiday meal for the Boys and Girls Club of Santa Rosa, California.

imdb.title: Dinner: Impossible
plot: Each episode Chef Robert Irvine, along with his two sous-chefs, George and George, must complete a different culinary challenge in a limited amount of time.::MS
